channel.title: Making a Stall Thievable from all directions [PI]
channel.description: So I'm currently Re-Writing my Thieving.java class but I have one problem I've encountered. When stealing from a stall (Those in Ardougne) I have to face a specific way, or have to be on a specific side to be able to steal from it. How can I go about fixing this? What can I add? It would really help me, thanks.

item.title: Making a Stall Thievable from all directions [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

So I tried doing this

case 2563: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(958, 350, 75); //Grey Wolf Fur if (c.objectX == 2663 && c.objectY == 3296) { //Those coords being my stalls coords if (c.absX == 2663) { c.getPA().walkTo2(-1,0); } else if (c.absX == 2664) { c.getPA().walkTo2(1,0); } }

But it’s still the same, what am I supposed to put in exactly? Sort of confused by coords

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Stall Thievable from all directions [PI]
